website_summaries.verdict: The best choice for consumers who want a rugged, basic wheelbarrow without spending a lot of money. The best deal available.
pros: A lightweight wheelbarrow that is easy to maneuver
Two pneumatic tires and cushioned loop handle offer exceptional control
cons: Lightweight design is not ideal for very heavy loads
Our testers noted that the tires are prone to going flat

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Yard Rover for over a month now and highly recommend it. It's hauled over 1,000 pounds of dirt as we rebuilt our raised bed gardens and handled it like a pro. While some people complained about it being hard to put together, if you just read and follow the directions it goes together quite easily. I've had no problems with the tires, which many reviewers complained about. Overall, it's a great wheelbarrow and the large wheels make it a breeze to move around the uneven ground of my yard.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: Went together quickly. The quality of the bolts could be better. They use shallow slotted stove bolts. Hard to hold the head steady with a screwdriver when tightening the nuts. Carriage bolts would have been better. Grease for the axels is not provided. I coated it with a heavy grease. Rolls very nicely now. Very stable. Strong rubber smell from the tires. You will want to store this outside. Made in China - no surprise.
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Marathon Dual-Wheel Residential Yard Rover Wheelbarrow and Yard Cart REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Great for around your yard projects with having two air-filled wheels instead of one which most have making this one easier to handle, and balance. Was easy to put together out of the box. Have used it for moving dirt, moving small loads of brick, and used as a cart for tools also. This wheelbarrow is for lighter home projects, NOT Commercial or real heavy loads,
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Smokie Mad

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product, the screw heads are difficult to tighten, even getting the screws tight the whole thing is wobbly and feels like it's going to fall apart. If return it if it wouldn't cost me more time to disassemble and pack and mail. Just avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: They are great because you can maneuver them with one hand and ...
customer_reviews.text: Today, I am ordering my 5th one of these, this one is for my mother. We have two for our 5-acre property; one for my mother-in-law and one for my aunt. One of ours we've had for 4 years and during the summer is used constantly - except for a new tire it has taken the abuse and kept on going. They are great because you can maneuver them with one hand and they will handle a whole load of mulch or compost. My mother-in-law and my aunt rate them as an essential gardening tool now. These get 5 stars from us.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: The wheelbarrow that could ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty good for the money. It’s nothing like a professional one. It was very important to me to have two wheels, rather than one. This is great to maneuver. It’s balanced in the middle of the basin, so if you off-balance it forward it tips right over. I was moving loose material and this is really easy to dump and spread. On the other hand if he loaded with lots of heavy tools, be careful and weight it to the back
customer_reviews.author: db_review

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR OLD LADY WITH ARTHRITIS!
customer_reviews.text: I’m an old lady with severe hand & knee arthritis, and I LOVE this cart! I’ve had it for about 5 months now and have used it dozens of times for everything from transporting and dumping weed cuttings, to piles of rocks, to sheet metal (I laid the sheet metal across the top of it). It is a life saver for me for several reasons: 1) It’s super lightweight, very stable because of its 2 wheels, and has a good rubber cushion on the handle. I have severe hand arthritis, so all those features are a huge benefit to me and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: FlyingPiano

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great, Good Quality for Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Wheelbarrow for a single project on my yard. I was removing and replacing my gravel yard (I live in Arizona), and then I would give this to Goodwill. This Wheelbarrow handled 20 Tons of stone, to and from my yard. The inflatable wheels worked very well for this project. The only part I had to modify, was HEAVIER PINS on the outside of the wheels. Two years later and I still have this Wheelbarrow (I still use it for yard work). Good quality for the price, I recommend this Wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sayers

customer_reviews.title: Company has not responded
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wheelbarrow over a month ago. It was missing the last piece, a cotter pin. I can't go out due to my age and covid. The company has not responded to four requests for a cotter pin. It's kind of ridiculous. If your wheelbarrow comes with all the pieces, maybe it'll be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for light yard work
customer_reviews.text: Very stable, easy to move and tip. For a wheelbarrow it's attractive. It's exactly what I was looking for. The assembly video is excellent - be sure to assemble on a table; it's awkward and frustrating to try to do it on the floor. It is solid enough, but I did make one addition. I've had bolt-heads chew through plastic wheelbarrow pans before, so although the pan is fairly thick and stiff, I added 3/4 inch washers (1/4 inch hole) to the 4 bolts before pushing them through the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in New York

customer_reviews.title: Nice for general garden use
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy garden cart for moving things around a home garden. It is not a replacement for a wheelbarrow due to the limitations other reviews mention. The plastic hopper portion is somewhat lightweight and a bit too flexible for precise dumping of the contents. However, its two wheel design makes it very stable and easy to either push or pull around. I now use it more often than my wheelbarrow for everyday garden chores. I have had it for 9 months and it has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F.

customer_reviews.title: Serves the Purpose
customer_reviews.text: On the positive side, it's light weight and very easy to push and the padded handle is very comfortable. Assembly wasn't terribly difficult however the plastic 'cushions' that go between the handle and plastic tray didn't fit right. Directions say to put the bolt thru the bottom hole in the cushion but doing so wouldn't allow for the cushion to fit snug between the handle and tray. We tried putting it in the top hole but - that didn't work either so we just put it together per the directions and called it good.
customer_reviews.author: Linda O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: Tires are garbage
customer_reviews.text: After 18 months of very occasional use, neither tire will hold air. Have been filling them each time it’s used for about a year now, but now both are bad and one hold no air at all. It’s also difficult to find replacement wheels and solid tires in this size. A good product, except for the tires.
customer_reviews.author: chuckb

customer_reviews.title: Most stable wheelbarrow ever!
customer_reviews.text: Got this because it looked stable. My old one was a typical 3 wheel and was so wobbly. I absolutely love this. It makes hauling anything to my dumpster easy. I can basically use one hand even when it is completely full. Smooth glide and no chance of tipping over. Have a dumpster because I have horses. I am 62 yo and not quite as strong as I used to be so this really helps. Don't be fooled by how low it is - it holds plenty!
customer_reviews.author: kgs

customer_reviews.title: Very very impressed
customer_reviews.text: For smaller loads, this is the perfect wheelbarrow. Very sturdy!!!!! Even with a repaired broken hip, this is super easy to use. Whether for sawdust for horse stalls, limestone for the driveway, or collecting misc items to put away. Also very kid friendly!!!!! Assembly was required, but super easy to put together. Took about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: SAYS FLAT FREE TIRES ( NOT )
customer_reviews.text: Mad that it says FLAT FREE tires this is not true they are very cheap rubber that you must fill with air the cart would be great if it were not for this I am returning it any garden cart out in the sun or used only every week or so will lose air and rubber will crack and it is almost impossible to find real actual flat free tires for products made in china
customer_reviews.author: MRBILL

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: After four months of heavy use hauling leaves and gravel and everything in between, this has taken a beating and not cracked nor rusted. The tires are in fantastic condition. The foam on the handle though has ripped and almost fallen off
customer_reviews.author: TomlinStar

customer_reviews.title: Yard Rover
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in a fairly light package. All the parts were there. The instructions were easy to read and understand. The assembly went quick with very little effort. The bucket is a molded plastic, I guess I was expecting metal so I was a little disappointed. The tires need to be pumped up; otherwise, I like the little yard rover and I look forward to putting it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Super shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good Utility Wheelbarrow for lighter gardening/yardwork
customer_reviews.text: It's a good, little wheelbarrow. Not a big bucket, perhaps half the size of the full-sized, heavy duty wheelbarrow I have. But it's much lighter and easier to move, much less prone to any rot or rust, and much more cost effective. I've been using mine for well over a year now, and I have no signs of wear and tear, although I did have to put a little air in the tires. I've used it for hauling soil, mulch, rocks, beauty bark, chicken poop, hay, straw, tools. Like I said, it's a fairly small wheelbarrow, but it can handle any garden and small landscaping activities.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Is it a Wheelbarrow a WheelS-barrow?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife who tries to heavily load a traditional wheelbarrow and immediately dumps it over and then I get to move whatever she's trying to move. Durning a recent cold spell I used it to move firewood from the stack to the house and it works great. Certainly not for hauling cinder blocks/concrete all day, but for light home use, it should do fine. And the wife likes it, so all is well.
customer_reviews.author: RayT

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I love pink so I ordered it. It's cute, it looks like a kids wheel barrel and I can use it around the house and maybe a job or to of mine. I hope to get a couple years out of it we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Vieira-Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Could use better hardware, not convinced of the durability
customer_reviews.text: All of the hardware is plated, not stainless. The bolts that hold the poly body onto the frame have pretty small heads, not much to keep from pulling through the plastic. I'm going to add some fender washers and replace the body bolts with stainless. Otherwise, goes together quickly. Mine was missing hardware because of rather simplistic boxing (not sealed well, hole in hardware bag), but nothing I didn't have on hand. We'll see how durable it is. It does have pneumatic tires. Some people like these. I don't, because you have to remember to refill them, and you usually don't notice they need air until you've already filled the thing.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ezell

customer_reviews.title: Great Grocery Cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as I'm handicapped and have trouble walking and can not carry or lift. The distance from our driveway to our home door is about 150 to 175 feet and we shop only twice a month as we live in the country. The 2 wheel is great for her to load bags and bags of groceries in and get them to the house. The big complaint we have is for the 2 years we have had it we have had to add air to both tires every month like clock work. Being retired and on a limited income we do what we have to to get by.
customer_reviews.author: TRHenderson

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: everything about this is perfect for me. the size and stability and the fun color. the only downfall is i have it hanging on a Rubbermaid wheelbarrow hanger outside that puts the handle up top and holds by the actual bucket top and bottom vertically. after a few weeks of hanging with the weight on the front, the plastic is sagging and bent up the front end. i used it and put something heavy in the front and by the end of my project, it was back to its original form. i now hang it upside down so the flat part is taking the weight and not the front end. so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: kcwoods

customer_reviews.title: Parts mis aligned.
customer_reviews.text: When I tried to put this together the holes in piece 1 and 2 were mis aligned on one side and piece 2 was also slightly warped making it very difficult to slide the pieces on causing the paint to strip. When I called to get a replacement the lady at Amazon was pleasant but they were out of the green so they have to send me a pink replacement to use the parts and I'll have to return the pink barrel and parts that are not aligned from green. The Manufacturer is only open on weekdays so they couldn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: duct tape for protection!
customer_reviews.text: So far, it is working well. I use it to pick up manure in my field. My tires were in good shape when I got them. I did find a few hard prickles stuck in them after a few days, but they did not make any holes in the tires. I got out my duct tape and wrapped each tire with maybe 15 revolutions around each tire for a little protection. Couldn't hurt. For really good tire protection, maybe get some foam pipe insulation and slice it longways. Wrap it around each tire and then go at it with the duct tape. Those flat free tires are really expensive. I have had the cart for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Balance the Load
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed. I already have a regular wheelbarrow -- metal body, wooden handles and one front wheel. I need to pick up and relocate rocks scattered all over my property. Once I load up, I find it impossible to balance the load. This unit solves that. Having two front wheels is perfect. It automatically maintains a balance. The unit is also lighter than my regular wheelbarrow because the bucket is made of high grade plastic. It takes a licking and doesn't warp or dent. Believe me: I have used this unit and it really works. I going to give my old wheelbarrow to a local garden group.
customer_reviews.author: M. F. MURPHY

customer_reviews.title: This is the best wheel barrow out there- the Rolls Royce of (etc
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my well abused conventional old red wooden one wheeled model that could not be repaired for the 100th time. This is the best wheel barrow out there- the Rolls Royce of (etc.)
customer_reviews.author: GoofyFoot

customer_reviews.title: Flat Tire in Less than a Year
customer_reviews.text: Hello Marathon. I purchased this wheelbarrow last August, it is March. I was hopeful spending $80 would hold up the tires more than 8 months. One is punctured. New tires that won't go flat are $40 each. Would you split this with me please?
customer_reviews.author: Angela Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great multipurpose garden wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.text: This garden wheelbarrow balances beautifully, carries a decent sized load, and maneuvers on low steps. The center style wheel was not working for us it was tipsy when no evenly weighted.
customer_reviews.author: Finnish Daisy

customer_reviews.title: CUTE PINK WHEELBARROW
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because it's pink. Does the job. Just make sure to tighten all of the bolts really well or it will fall apart. Learned that with the first use. Needs some muscle to put together.
customer_reviews.author: groomergirl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worthless - have to ship the giant defect back.
customer_reviews.text: The holes that line up for assembly of the handle part are totally off on one side making it absolutely impossible to put together unless I can drill a new hole in the correct place on the one part of the handle. I am so frustrated that I have to package up this huge piece of junk and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good for farm and stable
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I can lift up on the handle and push it easily without risking banging my shins on the undercarriage or tipping the contents, uphill or downhill. It empties easily and, having two wheels, I don't have to stabilize the load laterally with my back, as I would with one wheel. It's light weight so virtually all the load I'm moving is the load itself and not the weight of the wheelbarrow. It has a capacity to hold the day's manure of four 700lb ponies. It replaces an identical wheelbarrow that lasted 8 or 9 years of use and storage outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: cara drouin

customer_reviews.title: Stays level and balanced
customer_reviews.text: I received mine yesterday, worked with it all day today and love it. Two wheels give you great balance and the single bar handle is comfortable, no bending down to grab handles. The wheelbarrow doesn't tip down and stays stable when you pick up to roll, unlike my other wheelbarrow. It was easy to assemble. I'm very happy with this little yard helper!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Poorly engineered, difficult assembly
customer_reviews.text: Poorly misaligned holes resulting in uneven fit latterly on the bottom, 1/8 inch difference . Excessive paint on pieces that fit into each other, sanding down the paint the only solution for fit. Handlebars so poorly crafted, fully a 3/4 inch out of alignment for fit, had to be bent to fit. 2nd set of hands needed to fit crossbar related to overall bad holes and alignment. Bed of wheel barrow made of easily scratched thin plastic that was already damaged in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: strip very easily. Save time toss the nuts\bolts that comes with ...
customer_reviews.text: The bolts (both the threading and the screwdriver head fitting) strip very easily. Save time toss the nuts\bolts that comes with it and buy better hardware. Hex heads are much easier to tighten anyway. Use larger washers to add integrity to the plastic too. Without the larger washers on top and bottom, the original hardware will rip through the plastic with heavy use. I'd give this product 5 stars if the hardware was improved.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: The assembly was easy with good instructions
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived on time and was well packaged. The assembly was easy with good instructions . I LOVE this not so small wheel barrel and will use it constantly year round in my yard. Do not hesitate placing your order if you need something sturdy, easy to maneuver and is just high enough you don't hav eto bend your knees to pull or push.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia Q. Holguin

customer_reviews.title: Love it. This was a gift for a female ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This was a gift for a female gardener and she loves it too. It is very easy to push/pull. She uses it for everything from heavy things like hauling rocks and soil to toting plants. It has been a big success and I plan on getting one for my home use as well
customer_reviews.author: Carol R

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the handiest wheelbarrow ever ! While the tub does have some flex it continues to do all I ask of it! I have placed a 60qt ARTIC cooler full of ice and beer and it doesn't even flinch. The dual inflatable wheels are a dream. It pulls and pushes with ease!
customer_reviews.author: George Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Old lady missed the boat
customer_reviews.text: I wish I’d bought this about 45 years ago. I can’t believe what a difference this makes in yard work, mini construction projects, painting, blah, blah, blah. I use it ALL the time. It’s a huge time saver and everything is in it and you can move it around. I should have bought one of these a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Dee

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: I've used this wheelbarrow for the past year. It was relatively easy to put together, but the real beauty of the product is the ease of use. It is super-steady, light weight, and maneuverable. Why aren't all wheelbarrows made this way? For light to moderate use, it is exceptionally capable. I routinely haul 9 cubic feat of pine mulch at a time (in 3 cubic foot bags) without difficulty (about 80 bags so far this season). Unlike some things I've bought and just put aside (sounded good at the time), this has been well used. As an avid gardener, this is something I couldn't live without.
customer_reviews.author: For What It's WorthTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A good light-weight wheel barrow.
customer_reviews.text: A good wheel barrow for the price. I'd be a little careful about how much weight you put in it, though. Maybe 75 lbs. max. I suspect much more would cause cracking of the plastic bed. The big wheels are a definite plus - very easy to push around.
customer_reviews.author: ELB

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving this wheel-barrow.
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this wheel-barrow. It was not very difficult to put together (probably took me about 30-40 minutes), and it's incredibly light and easy to move around. Having two wheels makes it very steady and easy to maneuver. It's probably not the highest quality materials, so if you needed something for very heavy duty materials (bricks or stones or something), this may not be for you; but otherwise, I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Parts Kit. The assembly instructions calls for 2 of the 8X65 bolts. It's not even an option in the parts kit included
customer_reviews.text: This manufacturers does not include the required bolts to assemble this wheelbarrow. Although the instructions calle for 8x65mm bolts, they are not included nor listed on the sealed parts kit. Be prepared to waste a lot of your time chasing down the hardware required for assembly (see attached pictures)
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Tires hold pressure well (tires are a common wheelbarrow problem) . We haul 200 pounds of mulch in it and we have hauled paving stone in with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me.
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite for everything. Firewoood, manure, haybales, rocks. Feels a little dinky, and a smallish tub but it rolls so easy and is the perfect hight for kids and my wife and light enough I can bend over to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat disappointed in quality of the product. The bolts were hard to tightes because of the shallow screedriver slots in the bolt heads and the bolt holes in the fram ant the cart didn't line up properly. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Morris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent light workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to transport 4000lbs of concrete in 80lb bags to my backyard, 3 bags at a time. It did very well. The “barrow” part is soft plastic so if you plan to dump it by tipping it forward you may run into issues with it breaking. It’s so light and easy to move.
customer_reviews.author: aronf_53

customer_reviews.title: Very handy wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: This product works well for all the normal yard/garden chores I have during the year. The dual-wheel makes it easy to push/pull. The one piece handle and dual-wheels make this the ideal wheel barrow for light to medium duty use. I do use an old metal contractors wheelbarrow for moving large rocks. I'd hate to scuff this one...
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: assembly was easy and took me between 30-45 min. I would rather have something with 3 wheels but this gets the job done. I've had it a few months now and haven't had any problems with it. It stays outside and looks brand new still.
customer_reviews.author: L.F

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The design of this wheel barrow makes hauling a load very easy. It is more balanced and does not tip or fall over. Lightweight as well. A must have product in my book.
customer_reviews.author: John Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very durable little workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little wheel barrow. I have ten acres and take this all over with me. The terrain is mostly gravel with some forest and it does well moving easily. I'm able to haul bark dust, mulch, tools, etc... I can't imagine being without it!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled it is a very nicely made product. The instructions advise not to tighten anything, even with that in mind you are going to need a hammer and a block of wood to pound the frame together so that the holes line up. The assembly of the barrow to the frame is challenging. I found using a big clamp helped temporarily hold everything lined up so I could get the bolts through all the holes (an extra set of hands would have helped as well). The wheels went on nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie C

customer_reviews.title: We had to drill a hole in the handle to ...
customer_reviews.text: We had to drill a hole in the handle to attach it. One side was correctly drilled and the other not drilled at all. It is too heavy to just return it but we will think twice about ordering from you again.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Di

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, and Very Stable Wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: I like that this wheelbarrow is so lightweight. With two front wheels it is also very stable. And the pink color is fun.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great garden barrow.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, has good balance and is light weight enough for our old bodies to move around. It has a terrible smell to it, when it arrives, so make sure you let it sit out for a week or two for the wheels to outgas. It is sturdy and designed very well. We have a 1/4 acre and move plants and materials a lot and this is saving our backs.
customer_reviews.author: Ramagart

customer_reviews.title: Make moving anything easy
customer_reviews.text: I use it to haul yard debris, dirt, concrete blocks, even an old roll of carpet. It's sturdy, well balanced and easy to push thanks to the large wheels. I would definitely buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garden without a walker now.
customer_reviews.text: I like this pink user-friendly wheelbarrow because it gives stability, maneuverability, and safety as I move around the backyard, gardening without a walker. "Penelope" gives confidence to this 80-year-old who loves to be fashionable while being functional.
customer_reviews.author: Judylaine

customer_reviews.title: good price, stable stuff carrier.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the stability that the dual wheels provide. It's not supper struddy, but at the price I feel this one is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Carney

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just in time. We were hit by Hurricane Irma and it was just what i needed to clean up all the twigs, limbs, wood, etc. from the yard. Lightweight and delivered to our door! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jayne L. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, great balance, handle is well designed. The 2 bolts holding the cross strut on both fell of in a 2 day mulching project. One was lost, but problem was solved with a cable tie. Very light and easy to use, manoever. strong
customer_reviews.author: Erik de Perik

customer_reviews.title: Best wheelbarrow I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wheelbarrow I have used. The dual wheels and padded handle make it easy to move and I don't have to worry about it tipping over. It's more than big enough to handle everything I need it to do. The poly tub also makes it light enough I can pick it up and hang it from a hook in my shed. Assembly took less than 20 minutes which included unpacking it from the shipping carton. UPDATE: I've had this for almost a year and I still love it. I've used it to haul heavy and awkward items and it still stays steady. I even mixed concrete in it and it worked great and cleaned up easily.
customer_reviews.author: DaPom

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice enough cart for the price but a bit lightweight ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice enough cart for the price but a bit lightweight for my needs. The plastic hull is thick but it bends with the item is tipped to empty it out.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M in Tucson

customer_reviews.title: An easy to handle, durable small wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: This is my second yard rover, the first lasted more than 20 years and is still sort of usable if a bit long in the tooth. It is a perfect small, easy to handle wheelbarrow, good for all but real heavy duty stuff. Assembly is easy if you go to the Marathon Industries website and watch their video. The paper instructions are a bit cluttered and confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Ferman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it, the single handle makes it sturdier
customer_reviews.author: Mildred Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great Wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: This wheelbarrow was easy to put together. Relatively speaking it is light weight . I love the two wheels - it is easy to maneuver. Bought it for a specific job and it is making our lives easier. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: Bought early to give as a wedding groom gift, Shower last week, groom calked,to let me know putting together... no axle.. (part #5 is missing) Hopefully we will be able to get the part Otherwise happy wirh atyke, ease of assembly
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good Yard Cart
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new yard cart and purchased this because it looked like a good mix of yard cart and wheel barrow. I have a traditional wheel barrow but it is heavy and clumsy to use. My old yard cart is still functional but very deep and requires a lot of bending way over to only move a few things. I love my pink yard cart with its big wheels and use it exclusively to move everything from plants to pavers to dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Blade

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice and Light Garden Cart!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday, Assembled it. Used it to clear gravel from my yard today. I love the 2 wheel construction. The thing I Like least about it was that horrible outgassing when unpacked. I think it is the tires!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Herald

customer_reviews.title: Retired in southeast Florida and like working in the yard
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought one of these years ago. Retired in southeast Florida and like working in the yard. This wheelbarrow is the perfect size for yard projects. I wouldn't carry cement blocks in it but it perfect for my little yard planting and mulching projects.
customer_reviews.author: Florida John

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: I had to find the manual online, which was easy. The manufacturer has posted the manual online in pdf format. I bought this as a Christmas gift for my mother who loves to garden. Not only is it a nice feminine pink color, but the size of the wagon itself is just right for my mom. The only down-side in my opinion is that the tires are inflatable, which will eventually require patch-ups and replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Dual-wheel barrow
customer_reviews.text: So far it works as advertised. Although it was a refurbished (2nd hand) item, I didn't expect it to be so beaten up underneath, but I guess that's ok since I'll use it our doors anyway.
customer_reviews.author: charles m

customer_reviews.title: Nice wheelbarrow, but it's not heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble, but note it is lightweight, would never hold up for heavy duty use, like hauling sand, gravel, mixing concrete, etc. It will work great for lightweight use, like hauling mulch, grass clippings, leaves, etc. It is easy to look at the picture and assume it is heavy duty, it is not. But as long as the buyer understands that. I think they will be pleased with their purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Easy to maneuver. Rolls easily. The only negative was putting it together. Also, I wouldn't use this for heavy rocks. It's more for lighter, less sharp objects.
customer_reviews.author: M. Newman

customer_reviews.title: not heavy duty at all:(
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is not what I expected at all. For $85. I could have gotten a heavy duty one at Home Depot. Oh well ya live and learn *UPDATE* I have now had this cart for 3 years and it has actually held up pretty well. It has been left in the yard in the weather and is just now getting rusty. I actually prefer it to my heavy duty one because its so nice and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Polega

customer_reviews.title: Great little cart!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific little cart. I am able to easily haul clippings/brush through a rocky trail in the woods for dumping. It was a little tricky to assemble, but for the price the assembly was a minor inconvenience. I would have liked a cart larger than 5 cubic feet, but it was more important to me that I have a plastic cart. I was replacing a wooden (particle board) cart that was heavier and could not be left outside.
customer_reviews.author: Ldon

customer_reviews.title: Best wheelbarrow ever invented!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't own this, buy it. It's light weight, can be pushed or pulled. It's stable. It's everything you could ever hope for in a wheel barrow. I get so many compliments and so many people have purchased this wheel barrow because of me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and great to use! I like the big rubber tires, smooth riding, easy to push, and very quiet! My last yard cart had noisy plastic wheels!
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for small woman
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to replace one bought at a "big box" store, which was assembled incorrectly by the store, and was missing parts. This one had all the parts in one box, and it was simple to assemble. It's a perfect size for my wife, and the dual wheels are almost a necessity on our rocky, uneven New England property. Very impressed with the engineering and manufacturing quality.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT G FULLER

customer_reviews.title: Yard helper
customer_reviews.text: I love this wheelbarrow! It's perfect for yard work, weeding, carrying mulch, etc. Its small and light shape make it easy to wheel and get into smaller spaces, and I don't have to worry about it getting out of alignment and falling over as with the 1 wheel variety. I would highly recommend for light work and for those of us who can't lift heavy weights.
customer_reviews.author: DCL

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and maneuvers very easily. Also has pneumatic tires and a padded single ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and maneuvers very easily. Also has pneumatic tires and a padded single handle. Use it almost every day. Very durable. Have even mixed concrete in it.
customer_reviews.author: Regina M. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a replacement for the same model that I bought nearly 10 years ago. Had I kept my original in a shed it wouldn't have rusted.
customer_reviews.author: deborah hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not a bargain. Bad tires.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years the right tire would not hold air. I noticed cracked surface and some peeling of the rubber. When I did a soap and water test itt showed multiple air leaks. I thought oh well I'll just have the tube repaired. I took it to my mechanic and he showed me multiple spots inside the tire where the belt was exposed and actually puncturing the tube. Bottom line? Cart ok. A bit lightweight. Rusting somewhat. Tires?--- total junk. Replacement? $44 bucks. Add that to your purchase price. Not a good deal. Rating- D-.
customer_reviews.author: smithcover

customer_reviews.title: Great, Steady Wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: This meets my needs because I'm a bit older, not divulging how old here, but enough. The two wheels make it much more steady than the one-wheel type. Great assist in yard work. Built a path using it. It is for not too much of a load, but then I couldn't handle a huge load anyway, so perfect! I did put it together myself and it didn't take long. Wasn't a difficult assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was originally satisfied with this product but after using it once, one of the tires went flat, no stickers, no nails or any visible reason for the flat. Took it to a tire place and when they tried to get the tire off to replace the tube the rim bent and cracked like an aluminum beer can. Cheap materials, to say the least. I ended up buying two solid tires on new rims. So if you don't mind spending an extra $45 to replace the tires this wheel barrow is fine. My next one will certainly be from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Powerpalms

customer_reviews.title: Cute pink... is two yrs it?
customer_reviews.text: It’s very cute and easy and low for kids to use. Plus it’s pink! It came missing a pin for the tires but we fixed that. It was a little awkward to put together, but figured it out. After 2 yrs ALL metal framing rotted. Will try to get more if possible bc plastic bowl still perfect!
customer_reviews.author: SpringHeelJack

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Somehow I ended up buy two of these but just did not want to go through the hassle of sending one back so I just kept both. Seems to work well and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves to garden. I got it for her 70th birthday and she loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: It is light but sturdy, stable and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cart for my 81 year old Mom since our wheel barrow was too heavy and unwieldy. She loves it and so do I! It is light but sturdy, stable and easy to maneuver. Wish we had it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: K. Yonker

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble (even with pictograms)
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in two days, easy to assemble (even with pictograms). Tray is plastic, so I will see how it holds up, but it is the best priced and highest rated wheelbarrow on the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves this Cart!  (so do I)
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this wheelbarrow. It is very light and sturdy and the price is great. Unlike the single wheel style- she can pull this around with one hand. It also can hold plenty of material. 2 larger diameter tires make it easier to maneuver and dump compared to the standard type wheelbarrow. You won't do wrong if you buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: we purchased this wheelbarrow 4 months ago and have since hauled rocks, trash, logs, bricks, tools and grandchildren in it over acres of undeveloped ranch land. it is lightweight and well balanced. one wheel needed air one time right after we got it but has held up great since. I would recommend this product if you are looking for a wheelbarrow this size.
customer_reviews.author: sandysatx

customer_reviews.title: Good Light Duty Wheel Barrow
customer_reviews.text: It has mainly good parts, however this is not suitable for heavy duty hauling. A few bags of mulch OK, filled with concrete probably not.
customer_reviews.author: JoeJanJr

customer_reviews.title: Women's wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome wheelbarrow for a woman. Lightweight, and the tires make it super easy to move. The size is also just right - holds a lot, but keeps one from getting over-ambitious. Used it to move rocks, mulch, topsoil, and dirt. Not as easy to empty as hoped, but definitely worth getting and keeping. Also easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Deb in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Great little wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: We received the wheelbarrow on time and as promised. It went together quickly with the well written instructions, a screwdriver and a socket wrench (a crescent wrench would work fine). The tub may be a bit shallow for some, but it's perfect for my wife to haul plants, mulch, topsoil and veggies from her garden. It is very stable and won't tip like a traditional wheelbarrow. Overall a great item and purchase.
customer_reviews.author: extrabilly

customer_reviews.title: I'm Glad I Got It!
customer_reviews.text: This garden cart was easy to put together and has shown itself to be a very competent hauler of garden tools, soils, mulch, plants, twigs and small branches. It's light, easy to maneuver, more stable than a standard wheelbarrow, and has a comfortable handle.
customer_reviews.author: value hunter

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced inexpensive wheelbarrow
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Lightweight - plastic barrow makes this light - Well balanced - barrow sits over wheels, making it easier to move than a traditional wheelbarrow - Sturdy (enough) - wheels and frame are solid, steel - Inexpensive Cons: - Not super heavy duty (if that's what you need) - plastic barrow - (minor) Design - Doesn't stand well on it's end, either on its own or leaning against something - to keep from collecting rain. Overall I am pleased with it, prefer this to a basic Home Depot wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: ppitha

customer_reviews.title: Light weight good value holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Light weight good value. I mixed 60lb bags of cement in this....29 bags so far....and hauled rocks and debris in it....held up better than I expected for a plastic wheel barrow.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Tires go flat, and bolts rust
customer_reviews.text: Marathon industries 5- cubic ft poly residential yard rover. I bought this after reading the good reviews, but after having it for a couple years I can only say it was a big disappointment. These days both tires go flat after a day or so, and I don't want to pump up tires every time I use it. That would be enough to avoid this, but the metal parts have started to rust pretty bad. And the third strike is in the design. There is no way to store it tilted up like a normal wheelbarrow. It then gets water in the pan, and those bolts also rust. Avoid this, and save yourself a lot of trouble down the line!
customer_reviews.author: coolrock111

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Is working wonderfully for me. Had an injured hand so I couldn't use a traditional wheelbarrow, but this works great for me even now that my hand is better. Big enough to hold 6 large bags of cat food easily
customer_reviews.author: TheLadyKT

product_meta.title: Marathon Dual-Wheel Residential Yard Rover Wheelbarrow and Yard Cart - Green
product_meta.description:
Color:Green/Gray

The Marathon Yard Rover is one of the most popular two-wheel wheelbarrows on the market. Its lightweight, ergonomic design makes yard work a breeze with lower lifting effort, easier balancing and maneuverability. It’s perfect for common projects around the house for users of all ages and strengths. Yard Rover features a 36” long x 27.5” wide tray and 300 pound hauling capacity. It can haul materials such as mulch, top soil, logs, yard waste, debris, rocks and more. It makes the perfect outdoor gift for a gardener or backyard enthusiast.

The Marathon brand features a full line of air filled and flat free tire and wheel assemblies for lawn and garden and commercial/industrial equipment along with its own industry leading carts and wheelbarrows. This includes universal fit and exact match options to accommodate nearly every application. Count on Marathon for quality, easy-to-install products at a great value.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
High Quality 5 Cubic Foot Ladybug Poly Tray
feature_bullets: The Yard Rover features two, air-filled wheels, making it easier to lift, balance and maneuver.
The loop handle allows users to push, pull or dump the contents of the Yard Rover.
It features a rust-proof 5-cubic foot poly tray and 300-pound load capacity, perfect for residential use.
At 29 pounds, it weighs about 25% less than a typical wheelbarrow.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars715 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
